reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night and thoroughly enjoyed it. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The restaurant is excellent for dinner and breakfast. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the Smogen boardwalk. Smogen was an interesting stop on the Bohuslan coast and the Havsbad a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and location

reviews.text: I loved my time at Smogens Havsbad during mid-summer. The hotel was pared down Swedish design without feeling IKEA. I single dormer room at the top of the building and loved looking out the windows to the sea and the barely setting sun. If the journey from London wasn't so long, I would return again and again. Breakfast was great as was the service and the lovely room. There were single rooms available without single supplement here and throughout my trip to Sweden. If only more establishments would do the same.
reviews.title: Beautiful Swedish hotel and spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a night in the fall of Smögen sea. Ended up in the annexe which is probably an old converted school and have clear indications of this. Not exactly cozy hotel or some feeling there but a little department. The spa, which is very much advertising over and over was filled with people and no staff which meant that it was glass and empty bottles and clean cuit breaker and fuses. Additionally cuit breaker and fuses soundproof so it was a very noisy with lots of people.
reviews.title: Smögen Havsbad

reviews.text: Even had booked dinner in the evening. In conclusion, unfortunately, not romantic tranquility, but rather bears characterized by stress.
reviews.title: Average restaurant lacking in atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With a summer house on Smögen, we have had a number of meals at Smögens Havsbad over the years. Every year, we leave disappointed hoping that the place will improve for the next season.
reviews.title: Well situated - look for a better spa elsewhere

reviews.text: At the core of the problem is the fact that the hotel seems to be derive a large proportion of its revenues from conferences rather than families or couples. This means that the restaurant is built to cater to large groups of 20-50 people. As a result, the restaurant has an institutional canteen feel rather devoid of character. Considering the relatively high prices charged we expect both a better atmosphere and higher quality food. In addition, the service can be somewhat lacklustre and not up to international standards.
reviews.title: If only the service was better......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the lunch buffet is pretty good value for money at SEK 125 during weekdays and SEK 140 on Sundays. Especially so during the summer when you can sit outside and escape from the canteen feeling.
reviews.title: Great Location - nice hotel - eat out though
